00022 /// @defgroup cpSpace cpSpace
00023 /// @{
00024 
00025 typedef struct cpContactBufferHeader cpContactBufferHeader;
00026 
00027 /// Basic Unit of Simulation in Chipmunk
00028 struct cpSpace {
00029         /// Number of iterations to use in the impulse solver to solve contacts.
00030         int iterations;
00031         
00032         /// Gravity to pass to rigid bodies when integrating velocity.
00033         cpVect gravity;
00034         
00035         /// Damping rate expressed as the fraction of velocity bodies retain each second.
00036         /// A value of 0.9 would mean that each body's velocity will drop 10% per second.
00037         /// The default value is 1.0, meaning no damping is applied.
00038         /// @note This damping value is different than those of cpDampedSpring and cpDampedRotarySpring.
00039         cpFloat damping;
00040         
00041         /// Speed threshold for a body to be considered idle.
00042         /// The default value of 0 means to let the space guess a good threshold based on gravity.
00043         cpFloat idleSpeedThreshold;
00044         
00045         /// Time a group of bodies must remain idle in order to fall asleep.
00046         /// Enabling sleeping also implicitly enables the the contact graph.
00047         /// The default value of INFINITY disables the sleeping algorithm.
00048         cpFloat sleepTimeThreshold;
00049         
00050         /// Amount of encouraged penetration between colliding shapes..
00051         /// Used to reduce oscillating contacts and keep the collision cache warm.
00052         /// Defaults to 0.1. If you have poor simulation quality,
00053         /// increase this number as much as possible without allowing visible amounts of overlap.
00054         cpFloat collisionSlop;
00055         
00056         /// Determines how fast overlapping shapes are pushed apart.
00057         /// Expressed as a fraction of the error remaining after each second.
00058         /// Defaults to pow(1.0 - 0.1, 60.0) meaning that Chipmunk fixes 10% of overlap each frame at 60Hz.
00059         cpFloat collisionBias;
00060         
00061         /// Number of frames that contact information should persist.
00062         /// Defaults to 3. There is probably never a reason to change this value.
00063         cpTimestamp collisionPersistence;
00064         
00065         /// Rebuild the contact graph during each step. Must be enabled to use the cpBodyEachArbiter() function.
00066         /// Disabled by default for a small performance boost. Enabled implicitly when the sleeping feature is enabled.
00067         cpBool enableContactGraph;
00068         
00069         /// User definable data pointer.
00070         /// Generally this points to your game's controller or game state
00071         /// class so you can access it when given a cpSpace reference in a callback.
00072         cpDataPointer data;
00073         
00074         /// The designated static body for this space.
00075         /// You can modify this body, or replace it with your own static body.
00076         /// By default it points to a statically allocated cpBody in the cpSpace struct.
00077         cpBody *staticBody;
00078         
00079         CP_PRIVATE(cpTimestamp stamp);
00080         CP_PRIVATE(cpFloat curr_dt);
00081 
00082         CP_PRIVATE(cpArray *bodies);
00083         CP_PRIVATE(cpArray *rousedBodies);
00084         CP_PRIVATE(cpArray *sleepingComponents);
00085         
00086         CP_PRIVATE(cpSpatialIndex *staticShapes);
00087         CP_PRIVATE(cpSpatialIndex *activeShapes);
00088         
00089         CP_PRIVATE(cpArray *arbiters);
00090         CP_PRIVATE(cpContactBufferHeader *contactBuffersHead);
00091         CP_PRIVATE(cpHashSet *cachedArbiters);
00092         CP_PRIVATE(cpArray *pooledArbiters);
00093         CP_PRIVATE(cpArray *constraints);
00094         
00095         CP_PRIVATE(cpArray *allocatedBuffers);
00096         CP_PRIVATE(int locked);
00097         
00098         CP_PRIVATE(cpHashSet *collisionHandlers);
00099         CP_PRIVATE(cpCollisionHandler defaultHandler);
00100         CP_PRIVATE(cpHashSet *postStepCallbacks);
00101         
00102         CP_PRIVATE(cpBody _staticBody);
00103 };
00104 
00105 /// Allocate a cpSpace.
00106 cpSpace* cpSpaceAlloc(void);
00107 /// Initialize a cpSpace.
00108 cpSpace* cpSpaceInit(cpSpace *space);
00109 /// Allocate and initialize a cpSpace.
00110 cpSpace* cpSpaceNew(void);
00111 
00112 /// Destroy a cpSpace.
00113 void cpSpaceDestroy(cpSpace *space);
00114 /// Destroy and free a cpSpace.
00115 void cpSpaceFree(cpSpace *space);

00117 #define CP_DefineSpaceStructGetter(type, member, name) \
00118 static inline type cpSpaceGet##name(const cpSpace *space){return space->member;}
00119 
00120 #define CP_DefineSpaceStructSetter(type, member, name) \
00121 static inline void cpSpaceSet##name(cpSpace *space, type value){space->member = value;}

00123 #define CP_DefineSpaceStructProperty(type, member, name) \
00124 CP_DefineSpaceStructGetter(type, member, name) \
00125 CP_DefineSpaceStructSetter(type, member, name)

00127 CP_DefineSpaceStructProperty(int, iterations, Iterations);
00128 CP_DefineSpaceStructProperty(cpVect, gravity, Gravity);
00129 CP_DefineSpaceStructProperty(cpFloat, damping, Damping);
00130 CP_DefineSpaceStructProperty(cpFloat, idleSpeedThreshold, IdleSpeedThreshold);
00131 CP_DefineSpaceStructProperty(cpFloat, sleepTimeThreshold, SleepTimeThreshold);
00132 CP_DefineSpaceStructProperty(cpFloat, collisionSlop, CollisionSlop);

00140 /// returns true from inside a callback and objects cannot be added/removed.
00141 static inline cpBool
00142 cpSpaceIsLocked(cpSpace *space)
00143 {
00144         return space->CP_PRIVATE(locked);
00145 }
00146 
00147 /// Set a default collision handler for this space.
00148 /// The default collision handler is invoked for each colliding pair of shapes
00149 /// that isn't explicitly handled by a specific collision handler.
00150 /// You can pass NULL for any function you don't want to implement.
00151 void cpSpaceSetDefaultCollisionHandler(
00152         cpSpace *space,
00153         cpCollisionBeginFunc begin,
00154         cpCollisionPreSolveFunc preSolve,
00155         cpCollisionPostSolveFunc postSolve,
00156         cpCollisionSeparateFunc separate,
00157         void *data
00158 );
00159 
00160 /// Set a collision handler to be used whenever the two shapes with the given collision types collide.
00161 /// You can pass NULL for any function you don't want to implement.
00162 void cpSpaceAddCollisionHandler(
00163         cpSpace *space,
00164         cpCollisionType a, cpCollisionType b,
00165         cpCollisionBeginFunc begin,
00166         cpCollisionPreSolveFunc preSolve,
00167         cpCollisionPostSolveFunc postSolve,
00168         cpCollisionSeparateFunc separate,
00169         void *data
00170 );
00171 
00172 /// Unset a collision handler.
00173 void cpSpaceRemoveCollisionHandler(cpSpace *space, cpCollisionType a, cpCollisionType b);
00174 
00175 /// Add a collision shape to the simulation.
00176 /// If the shape is attached to a static body, it will be added as a static shape.
00177 cpShape *cpSpaceAddShape(cpSpace *space, cpShape *shape);
00178 /// Explicity add a shape as a static shape to the simulation.
00179 cpShape *cpSpaceAddStaticShape(cpSpace *space, cpShape *shape);
00180 /// Add a rigid body to the simulation.
00181 cpBody *cpSpaceAddBody(cpSpace *space, cpBody *body);
00182 /// Add a constraint to the simulation.
00183 cpConstraint *cpSpaceAddConstraint(cpSpace *space, cpConstraint *constraint);
00184 
00185 /// Remove a collision shape from the simulation.
00186 void cpSpaceRemoveShape(cpSpace *space, cpShape *shape);
00187 /// Remove a collision shape added using cpSpaceAddStaticShape() from the simulation.
00188 void cpSpaceRemoveStaticShape(cpSpace *space, cpShape *shape);
00189 /// Remove a rigid body from the simulation.
00190 void cpSpaceRemoveBody(cpSpace *space, cpBody *body);
00191 /// Remove a constraint from the simulation.
00192 void cpSpaceRemoveConstraint(cpSpace *space, cpConstraint *constraint);
00193 
00194 /// Test if a collision shape has been added to the space.
00195 cpBool cpSpaceContainsShape(cpSpace *space, cpShape *shape);
00196 /// Test if a rigid body has been added to the space.
00197 cpBool cpSpaceContainsBody(cpSpace *space, cpBody *body);
00198 /// Test if a constraint has been added to the space.
00199 cpBool cpSpaceContainsConstraint(cpSpace *space, cpConstraint *constraint);
00200 
00201 /// Post Step callback function type.
00202 typedef void (*cpPostStepFunc)(cpSpace *space, void *obj, void *data);
00203 /// Schedule a post-step callback to be called when cpSpaceStep() finishes.
00204 /// @c obj is used a key, you can only register one callback per unique value for @c obj
00205 void cpSpaceAddPostStepCallback(cpSpace *space, cpPostStepFunc func, void *obj, void *data);
00206 
00207 /// Point query callback function type.
00208 typedef void (*cpSpacePointQueryFunc)(cpShape *shape, void *data);
00209 /// Query the space at a point and call @c func for each shape found.
00210 void cpSpacePointQuery(cpSpace *space, cpVect point, cpLayers layers, cpGroup group, cpSpacePointQueryFunc func, void *data);
00211 /// Query the space at a point and return the first shape found. Returns NULL if no shapes were found.
00212 cpShape *cpSpacePointQueryFirst(cpSpace *space, cpVect point, cpLayers layers, cpGroup group);
00213 
00214 /// Segment query callback function type.
00215 typedef void (*cpSpaceSegmentQueryFunc)(cpShape *shape, cpFloat t, cpVect n, void *data);
00216 /// Perform a directed line segment query (like a raycast) against the space calling @c func for each shape intersected.
00217 void cpSpaceSegmentQuery(cpSpace *space, cpVect start, cpVect end, cpLayers layers, cpGroup group, cpSpaceSegmentQueryFunc func, void *data);
00218 /// Perform a directed line segment query (like a raycast) against the space and return the first shape hit. Returns NULL if no shapes were hit.
00219 cpShape *cpSpaceSegmentQueryFirst(cpSpace *space, cpVect start, cpVect end, cpLayers layers, cpGroup group, cpSegmentQueryInfo *out);
00220 
00221 /// Rectangle Query callback function type.
00222 typedef void (*cpSpaceBBQueryFunc)(cpShape *shape, void *data);
00223 /// Perform a fast rectangle query on the space calling @c func for each shape found.
00224 /// Only the shape's bounding boxes are checked for overlap, not their full shape.
00225 void cpSpaceBBQuery(cpSpace *space, cpBB bb, cpLayers layers, cpGroup group, cpSpaceBBQueryFunc func, void *data);
00226 
00227 /// Shape query callback function type.
00228 typedef void (*cpSpaceShapeQueryFunc)(cpShape *shape, cpContactPointSet *points, void *data);
00229 /// Query a space for any shapes overlapping the given shape and call @c func for each shape found.
00230 cpBool cpSpaceShapeQuery(cpSpace *space, cpShape *shape, cpSpaceShapeQueryFunc func, void *data);
00231 
00232 /// Call cpBodyActivate() for any shape that is overlaps the given shape.
00233 void cpSpaceActivateShapesTouchingShape(cpSpace *space, cpShape *shape);
00234 
00235 
00236 /// Space/body iterator callback function type.
00237 typedef void (*cpSpaceBodyIteratorFunc)(cpBody *body, void *data);
00238 /// Call @c func for each body in the space.
00239 void cpSpaceEachBody(cpSpace *space, cpSpaceBodyIteratorFunc func, void *data);
00240 
00241 /// Space/body iterator callback function type.
00242 typedef void (*cpSpaceShapeIteratorFunc)(cpShape *shape, void *data);
00243 /// Call @c func for each shape in the space.
00244 void cpSpaceEachShape(cpSpace *space, cpSpaceShapeIteratorFunc func, void *data);
00245 
00246 /// Space/constraint iterator callback function type.
00247 typedef void (*cpSpaceConstraintIteratorFunc)(cpConstraint *constraint, void *data);
00248 /// Call @c func for each shape in the space.
00249 void cpSpaceEachConstraint(cpSpace *space, cpSpaceConstraintIteratorFunc func, void *data);
00250 
00251 /// Update the collision detection info for the static shapes in the space.
00252 void cpSpaceReindexStatic(cpSpace *space);
00253 /// Update the collision detection data for a specific shape in the space.
00254 void cpSpaceReindexShape(cpSpace *space, cpShape *shape);
00255 /// Update the collision detection data for all shapes attached to a body.
00256 void cpSpaceReindexShapesForBody(cpSpace *space, cpBody *body);
00257 
00258 /// Switch the space to use a spatial has as it's spatial index.
00259 void cpSpaceUseSpatialHash(cpSpace *space, cpFloat dim, int count);
00260 
00261 /// Step the space forward in time by @c dt.
00262 void cpSpaceStep(cpSpace *space, cpFloat dt);
